inclusion.criterion: Males age ≥ 18 with clinical diagnosis of neurogenic lower urinary tract dysfunction
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must be clinically suitable and capable of safely managing bladder using an intermittent voiding or indwelling strategy
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Must have stable urinary management history: no significant changes in bladder management regimen within past 12 months
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Must have urodynamic profile suitable for C2P, as assessed via urodynamics study within past 12 months (including bladder capacity > 200mL without uninhibited bladder contractions)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Subject's lower urinary tract anatomy must fall within the ranges serviceable by the C2P device, as specified in the investigational device instructions for use (IFU)
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Significant risk profile or recent history of urethral stricture (e.g. stricture within past 90 days)
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Significant risk profile or recent history of clinically significant autonomic dysreflexia (AD) (e.g. History of hospitalization due to AD within past 12 months)
exclusion.label: not_met

notes: Patient has a history of CVA, neurogenic bladder with indwelling suprapubic catheter and recurrent UTIs. However, the urosepsis is now resolved after treatment.
